players.name: Alice
memory: You: "Charlie, why did you remain silent? Bob, what are your thoughts on Diana's death?"
Bob: "I think it's suspicious Charlie didn't speak up. Alice makes a good point asking him. Diana's death means we need to be careful with our votes today."
You: "I agree with Bob, Charlie's silence is concerning. We need to pressure him to contribute before we vote."

Charlie: "I want to assure everyone that my silence during the previous discussion was not an act of complicity or fear. I simply needed time to process the information I had gathered and consider the best course of action for the safety of our village. Alice's accusation against me..."

Bob: "Charlie, your explanation for silence is weak. Processing information? We all have the same info. Alice is right to pressure you. I'm leaning towards voting Charlie unless he gives a solid defense."
Votes: Alice voted for Charlie, Bob voted for Charlie, Charlie voted for Alice
